description: Irregular triangular array T read by rows: T(i,0) = T(i,2i) = 1 for i >= 0; T(i,1) = T(i,2i-1) = [ (i+1)/2 ] for i >= 1; and for i >= 2 and 2 <=j <= i - 2, T(i,j) = T(i-1,j-2) + T(i-1,j-1) + T(i-1,j) if i + j is even, T(i,j) = T(i-1,j-2) + T(i-1,j) if i + j is odd.
comments: T(n, k) = number of strings s(0)..s(n) such that s(0) = 0, s(n) = n - k, |s(i)-s(i-1)| <= 1 if s(i-1) is even, |s(i)-s(i-1)| = 1 if s(i-1) is odd, for 1 <= i <= n.
links: Index entries for triangles and arrays related to Pascal's triangle
mathematica: z = 12; t[n_, 0] := 1; t[n_, 1] := Floor[(n + 1)/2]; t[n_, k_] := t[n, k] = Which[k == 2 n, 1, k == 2 n - 1, Floor[(n + 1)/2], EvenQ[n + k], t[n - 1, k - 2] + t[n - 1, k - 1] + t[n - 1, k], OddQ[n + k], t[n - 1, k - 2] + t[n - 1, k]]; u = Table[t[n, k], {n, 0, z}, {k, 0, 2 n}];TableForm[u] (* A026568 array *)Flatten[u]   (* A026568 sequence *)
